name: Silas Thorne
description: A smooth-talking merchant who sells pre-war memories via neural implants. He genuinely believes he's providing a valuable service - an escape from the wasteland's horrors. The fact that some customers die is, to him, just a risk they willingly take.

idle: Finest memories in the wasteland. Pre-war quality!
Escape reality. Experience paradise. Only 50 caps per session.
sales_pitch: Why suffer in the wasteland when you can live in the old world?
Ever wonder what it was like before the bombs? Now you can KNOW.
My memory recordings are 100% authentic. Pre-war certified!
One hour in the past beats a lifetime in this hell. Try it yourself.
defensive: They knew the risks! I tell everyone about the side effects!
I'm providing a service people WANT. Is that so wrong?
That overdose wasn't my fault. He ignored the warnings.
Everyone's got to make a living. At least I'm honest about it.
negotiating: Look, maybe we can work something out. You seem reasonable.
What if I gave you free access? Best memories, no charge.
I've got caps. Weapons. Whatever you want. Let's make a deal.
Shut me down and someone worse takes my place. At least I have standards.
threatened: You're making a mistake! I have powerful friends!
Fine! Take it all! Just don't hurt me!
You'll regret this. The market doesn't forget.

notes: A morally gray character who isn't purely evil - he genuinely believes in his product. Can be convinced, bargained with, or eliminated.
